body:
I have the same problem with Jsoup version 1.11.2
I'm using XML syntax to convert HTML to XHTML. I got the error:
`Unescaped '<' not allowed in attributes values`

You need to use the following setting:
> doc.outputSettings().escapeMode(Entities.EscapeMode.xhtml)

That will cause `<` to be preserved (while the other XML entities will have the same behaviour). This allows the resulting output to be parsed as XML/XHTML. __NOTE:__ This is not set when setting the output mode to XML.

Doesn't work for `&gt`. I get below output

`Output: <input class="text" value=" > data  < ">`

To confirm, you're referring to generating valid XML, right?

As @rhdunn points out, setting EscapeMode to xhtml looks to produce the right result. Only `<` needs to be escaped in XML attributes (and quote and `&`). The `>` does not.

We should make XML output mode set the escape mode, or otherwise make sure `<` gets escaped for XML. It doesn't need to be for HTML, though.

Let me know if I've misunderstood anything.

issue.body:
First of all, thanks a lot for this code. It works great.
However I noticed a weird behavior. In Entities.escape this case fragment exist

```java
case '<':
    // escape when in character data or when in a xml attribute val or XML syntax; not needed in html attr val
    if (!inAttribute || escapeMode == EscapeMode.xhtml || out.syntax() == Syntax.xml)
        accum.append("<");
    else
        accum.append(c);
    break;
case '>':
    if (!inAttribute)
        accum.append(">");
    else
        accum.append(c);
    break;
```

I was working wtih an xml that is something like
```xml
<xml>
<sometag> sometext
<innertag>
more text
<?xmlDeclaration att1="value1" att2="<val2>"?>
</innertag></sometag></xml>
```

and when extracted the document as string it looks like
```xml
<xml>
<sometag> sometext
<innertag>
more text
<?xmlDeclaration att1="value1" att2="<val2>"?>
</innertag></sometag></xml>
```

Is there any specifics why ">" is not considered the same as "<" for xmls?

Thanks in advance
